doc.field: Records of the English Graduate Association
Records of the English Graduate Association

The English Graduate Association was an organization founded in 1946 for students and alumni of the English program in the Graduate School of Arts and Science. The organization was later succeeded by the Graduate English Organization. The records of the English Graduate Association (dated 1946-1975) consist of materials documenting the group's founding, administrative activities, and lectures on literary topics. Materials include correspondence, lists of officers, meeting minutes, annual reports, and summaries of lectures.

The English Graduate Association was an organization founded in 1946 for students and alumni of the English program in the Graduate School of Arts and Science. The organization was later succeeded by the Graduate English Organization.
These materials were removed from the New York University Archives Collection of Publications and Ephemera during processing; their original provenance is unknown.
